controls.controlTitle: Audit Record Reduction and Report Generation

policies.name: Audit and Accountability Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing audit logging, audit record reduction, and report generation practices
policies.rationale: NIST 03.03.06 requires 'implement an audit record reduction and report generation capability' which necessitates formal policy guidance on audit log analysis and reporting

procedures.name: Audit Record Reduction Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for reducing and summarizing audit records using data mining techniques and filters to identify anomalous behavior
procedures.rationale: Control requires audit record reduction capability that 'manipulates collected audit information and organizes it in a summary format that is more meaningful to analysts'

procedures.name: Audit Report Generation Procedure
procedures.description: Process for generating customizable audit reports that support review, analysis, and reporting requirements for different audiences
procedures.rationale: Control requires report generation capability that 'supports audit record review, analysis, reporting requirements, and after-the-fact investigations of incidents'

procedures.name: Incident Investigation Procedure
procedures.description: Process for utilizing audit records to conduct after-the-fact investigations of security incidents
procedures.rationale: Control explicitly requires capability that 'supports...after-the-fact investigations of incidents'

executionEvidence.name: Monthly Audit Summary Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: period covered, total events analyzed, events by category, anomalies identified, summary statistics, trends analysis, original log references maintained
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates audit record reduction capability in operation; monthly frequency aligns with NIST AU-06 recommendation for regular audit review

executionEvidence.name: Quarterly Security Analysis Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: cross-system correlation analysis, organization-wide situational awareness findings, identified security concerns, remediation recommendations, executive summary
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates audit record reduction across different repositories supporting 'analysis, reporting requirements'; quarterly provides strategic overview

executionEvidence.name: Incident Investigation Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: incident timeline constructed from audit records, systems involved, user activities traced, evidence chain maintained, original audit record references, time ordering preserved
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates capability supports 'after-the-fact investigations of incidents' and preserves 'original content and time ordering of audit records'

executionEvidence.name: Audit Log Integrity Verification Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: hash verification of original logs, confirmation no alterations made during reduction process, time stamp sequence validation, original content preservation confirmed
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates compliance with requirement to 'preserve the original content and time ordering of audit records'

operationalActivities: Implement audit log reduction tools with data mining and filtering capabilities
Generate regular audit summary reports from reduced audit data
Maintain original audit records while creating summarized versions
Provide customizable report generation for different stakeholders
Support incident investigations with audit record analysis
Correlate audit records across different system repositories
Preserve time ordering and original content of all audit records

policies.name: Audit and Accountability Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing audit logging requirements including time stamp standards
policies.rationale: NIST 03.03.07 requires 'use internal system clocks to generate time stamps for audit records' which necessitates policy-level guidance on time synchronization requirements

policies.name: Time Synchronization Policy
policies.description: Policy defining time synchronization requirements, authoritative time sources, granularity standards, and UTC usage
policies.rationale: Control requires organization to define 'granularity of time measurement' and specify time source standards (UTC, local time with offset)

procedures.name: Time Synchronization Configuration Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for configuring NTP clients, selecting authoritative time sources, setting synchronization intervals, and configuring UTC or UTC offset
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'use internal system clocks' which must be properly synchronized; 'time is often expressed in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)'

procedures.name: Time Stamp Validation Procedure
procedures.description: Process for verifying time stamp accuracy, checking time drift, validating granularity meets requirements, and confirming proper format (UTC or offset)
procedures.rationale: Control requires time stamps 'meet organization-defined granularity of time measurement'; 'granularity of time measurements refers to the degree of synchronization between system clocks and reference clocks'

procedures.name: Audit System Clock Configuration Procedure
procedures.description: Process for configuring internal system clocks on all audit-generating systems to ensure consistent time stamping
procedures.rationale: Control explicitly requires 'use internal system clocks to generate time stamps for audit records'

executionEvidence.name: Time Synchronization Configuration Documentation
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: NTP server configurations, authoritative time sources configured, synchronization intervals set, UTC or UTC offset settings, granularity configured (e.g., milliseconds)
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates systems are configured to 'use internal system clocks' synchronized to authoritative sources; configuration typically stable unless infrastructure changes

executionEvidence.name: Time Drift Monitoring Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: systems monitored, time drift measurements, synchronization success rate, systems out of sync identified, corrective actions taken
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates ongoing compliance with 'granularity of time measurement' requirement; 'granularity...refers to the degree of synchronization...clocks synchronizing within hundreds or tens of milliseconds'

executionEvidence.name: Audit Log Time Stamp Samples
executionEvidence.description: Sample audit logs showing: time stamps in proper format (UTC or UTC with offset), appropriate granularity (date, time, subseconds), consistent formatting across systems
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates actual implementation of 'record time stamps for audit records that meet organization-defined granularity' and use UTC or UTC offset as required

executionEvidence.name: NTP Synchronization Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: successful NTP synchronization events, time adjustments made, synchronization failures and resolutions, time server availability
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates continuous operation of time synchronization to maintain 'granularity of time measurement' requirement

operationalActivities: Configure internal system clocks on all audit-generating systems
Configure NTP synchronization to authoritative time sources
Set time stamp granularity to meet organizational requirements (e.g., milliseconds)
Configure time stamps to use UTC or UTC offset
Monitor time drift across systems generating audit records
Investigate and remediate time synchronization failures
Validate audit log time stamps meet format and granularity requirements

policies.name: Audit and Accountability Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing protection of audit information and audit logging tools
policies.rationale: NIST 03.03.08 requires 'protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion' which necessitates formal policy-level guidance

policies.name: Access Control Policy
policies.description: Policy governing who can access audit information and under what circumstances, including separation of audit-related privileges from other privileges
policies.rationale: Control requires 'authorize access to management of audit logging functionality to only a subset of privileged users or roles'; 'requiring privileged access to be further defined between audit-related privileges and other privileges'

procedures.name: Audit Log Access Control Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for granting, reviewing, and revoking access to audit logs and audit information, ensuring least privilege access
procedures.rationale: Control requires protecting 'audit information...from unauthorized access'; 'audit information includes...audit records, audit log settings, audit reports, and personally identifiable information'

procedures.name: Audit Log Backup and Recovery Procedure
procedures.description: Process for backing up audit logs, testing backup integrity, and recovering audit information to prevent deletion
procedures.rationale: Control requires protecting audit information 'from...deletion'; backups ensure logs can be recovered if deleted

procedures.name: Privileged Access Management for Audit Systems Procedure
procedures.description: Process for managing who can administer audit logging functionality, separating audit-related privileges from other system privileges, and reviewing privileged access
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'authorize access to management of audit logging functionality to only a subset of privileged users or roles'; 'requiring privileged access to be further defined between audit-related privileges and other privileges limits the number of users...with audit-related privileges'

procedures.name: Audit Logging Tool Protection Procedure
procedures.description: Process for securing audit logging tools (SIEM systems, log collectors, analysis tools) from unauthorized access and modification
procedures.rationale: Control requires protecting 'audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion'; 'audit logging tools are programs and devices used to conduct audit and logging activities'

executionEvidence.name: Audit Log Access Control Lists
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: users/roles with audit log access, specific permissions granted (read-only vs. management), justification for access, approval documentation, access control configurations (RBAC/ACLs)
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates implementation of access controls to protect 'audit information...from unauthorized access' and 'authorize access to management...to only a subset of privileged users'

executionEvidence.name: Audit Log Permission Review Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: users with audit access reviewed, inappropriate access identified and removed, privilege separation verified (audit vs. other privileges), reviewer signatures, review date
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates ongoing validation that only authorized subset has access; verifies 'privileged access to be further defined between audit-related privileges and other privileges'

executionEvidence.name: Audit Log Backup Verification Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: backup completion status, backup integrity verified, retention period met, recovery testing results, backup storage protection measures
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates protection 'from...deletion'; regular backups ensure audit information can be recovered

executionEvidence.name: Audit Log Integrity Validation Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: hash verification of audit logs, unauthorized modification checks, file integrity monitoring results, tampering detection, investigation of any anomalies
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates protection 'from...modification'; 'individuals...who are also the subject of an audit...may affect the reliability...by...modifying audit records'

executionEvidence.name: Privileged Audit Access Review Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: privileged users with audit management capabilities, separation of audit privileges from other admin privileges, justification for audit management access, review of usage, recertification
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates 'authorize access to management of audit logging functionality to only a subset of privileged users or roles' with proper separation of duties

executionEvidence.name: Audit Log Access Attempts Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: attempted access to audit logs (successful and failed), privileged actions on audit systems, unusual access patterns identified, investigations of unauthorized attempts
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates monitoring of audit information protection; detects potential 'unauthorized access' attempts to audit information

operationalActivities: Configure RBAC or ACLs to restrict audit log access to authorized personnel only
Implement separate privileged roles for audit management vs. other system administration
Configure file system permissions to protect audit log files from modification and deletion
Implement automated backup of audit logs to protected storage
Enable file integrity monitoring on audit log files and directories
Review and approve all requests for audit log access
Conduct quarterly reviews of who has access to audit information
Investigate all unauthorized audit log access attempts
Protect audit logging tools (SIEM, log collectors) with access controls
Separate audit-related privileges from other system privileges in role definitions
